# Blizzard salary

Use the following visualizations for Question \_\_ through \_\_.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
blizzard_salary <- blizzard_salary |>
  mutate(annual_salary = case_when(
    salary_type == "week" ~ current_salary * 52,
    salary_type == "hour" ~ current_salary * 40 * 52,
    TRUE ~ current_salary
  )) |>
  filter(salary_type != "week") |>
  mutate(
    salary_type = if_else(salary_type == "hour", "Hourly", "Salaried")
  )
```
:::



In 2020, employees of Blizzard Entertainment circulated a spreadsheet to anonymously share salaries and recent pay increases amidst rising tension in the video game industry over wage disparities and executive compensation. @fig-blizzard contains two figures, both of which show the distributions of annual salaries of Blizzard employees.



::: {.cell layout-ncol="2"}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(blizzard_salary, aes(x = annual_salary)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 10000) +
  facet_wrap(~salary_type, ncol = 1) +
  scale_x_continuous(labels = label_dollar(scale = 1/1000, suffix = "K")) +
  labs(
    x = "Annual salary (in USD)",
    y = "Count"
  )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 56 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_bin()`).
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(blizzard_salary, aes(x = annual_salary)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 10000) +
  facet_wrap(~salary_type, nrow = 1) +
  scale_x_continuous(labels = label_dollar(scale = 1/1000, suffix = "K")) +
  labs(
    x = "Annual salary (in USD)",
    y = "Count"
  )
```
